definition: to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: When her statement was read a very cleat light was cast upon the situation.
sentences.chinese: 她的声明宣读后，情况便显得非常清楚了。

sentences.english: Heavily infected areas will appear thin and chlorotic (yellow to light brown).
sentences.chinese: 严重感染的地区会显得细瘦萎黄。

sentences.english: Her old-fashioned clothes really date her.
sentences.chinese: 她穿着老土，显得很老气。

sentences.english: His horse, Eastern Express, seemed ready to run and win the race.
sentences.chinese: 他的坐骑“东方快车”显得状态颇佳。

sentences.english: The stars are not afraid to appear like fireflies。
sentences.chinese: 群星不怕显得象萤火那样。

sentences.english: It'll make you seem needy as shit.
sentences.chinese: 那样会让你显得很傻帽。
他显得忧烦，且带有病色。

sentences.english: Breeze Xin I say the time of this sentence, seem to be to have a little out of breath.
sentences.chinese: 风间欣吾说这句话的时候，显得有点上气不接下气。

sentences.english: Up. He was still smiling, but his ocher eyes were serious.
sentences.chinese: 他还是微笑着，但他黑金色的眸子显得很认真。

sentences.english: Today all that seems pale and thin and very far away.
sentences.chinese: 现在，一切都显得疏落惨淡，一切都远离我们而去。

sentences.english: The motion has a distinct realistic quality, as the objects first accelerate and then decelerate.
sentences.chinese: 动作显得很逼真，选择的控件先是加速，再略略减慢。

sentences.english: The political rally was souped up by the appearance of the candidates.
sentences.chinese: 这次政治集会由于各候选人的出席而显得更为热闹。

sentences.english: But the internal inertia against doing so appears too great at this time.
sentences.chinese: 但反对这种作为的内部惰性这次似乎显得太过强大了。

sentences.english: As an observer to this culture, it seems generally trivial and trying.
sentences.chinese: 本片作为这种文化的观察者，便显得琐碎及令人烦厌。

sentences.english: It was incredible. They reached the shore and were shivering and nervous.
sentences.chinese: 刚一上岸，他俩显得相当紧张，并且止不住的发抖。

sentences.english: Therefore, the recognition to gas beneficial zone of this region shows extraordinarily important.
sentences.chinese: 因此，对该区天然气有利区带的认识显得非常重要。

definition: seemingly/apparently/looks as if/appear to be/gives the impression that/seems on the face of it to be
to present clearly/to give prominence to/to magnify/clear and obvious
to feel/to become aware of/feeling/sense/perception/CL:個|个[ge4]
very/completely/utterly/extremely/absolutely/hundred percent/to divide into ten equal parts
conspicuous/to make sth stand out/make sth prominent
